Articles.Content:
NASA just showed the awesome new SLS paint job! (flickr)

(also see video below)

Couldn't wait and had to try it out in KSP =)

Javascript is disabled. View full album

It is a repaint of stock parts. Once you install them, the originals will be overwritten.. BUT, the pack contains a backup in case you want to revert to the originals, so no worries

Textures of these parts are changed:

  • Big Kickback SRB, added the cool stripes
  • 3.75 Cluster engine, deblackened it, added some umbilical ports
  • 3.75 big tank, scraped off some paint from the tanks..
  • 3.75 medium tank
  • 3 to 2 adapter

Notes:

  • It does not contain any craft files
  • Couldn't play with specular on the tank parts, it seems tank parts' shaders are diffuse, even if the textures originally do contain an alpha channel.

Download:

Kerbalstuff: https://kerbalstuff.com/mod/1228/2015%20SLS%20CDR%20textures

https://drive.google.com/file/d/0B6-Kp1pObiWgVkl5VWJLMXI0OWc/view?usp=sharing

Credits:

  • Original textures by Squad
  • Repaint by Nothke

Licence:

I am not sure of what exactly licence it should be for modifying Squad's original work, so, I'll licence it under by-nc-sa 4.0

http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-nc-sa/4.0/

Edited October 23, 2015 by nothke

Wow, this SLS thing seems to be pretty big news to everyone!

Texture looks nice, man!
Boy, you were quick. Nice job. Could you host on Kerbal Stuff when you get a chance? Curse creeps me out.
try kerbalstuff. no wait times like curse, and not everyone can open 7z files

Boy, you were quick. Nice job. Could you host on Kerbal Stuff when you get a chance? Curse creeps me out.

Ah sure, TBH I couldn't find how to upload a new mod on Curse xD I remember when I did last time I needed like half an hour to dig up the right button.. (at least a year ago) But everything changed now, it's even worse! I don't get it...

So, yeah, I won't even try next time..

It's on kerbalstuff =)

https://kerbalstuff.com/mod/1228/2015%20SLS%20CDR%20textures
Could you provide a alternative texture with the use of Firespitter capability to change between them?

Could you make these textures compatible with textureReplacer rather than overwriting it? When i first heard that they were going to leave the tank unpainted and i saw on reddit that people wanted Squad to redo the SLS parts, I was not sure an orange SLS would even look good in game. Now that I see the Orange SLS in-game (outside of the RO Spice Launch System), I see that an orange tank would be pretty great. HOWEVER: Only for a really big tank. Keep the others Saturn-V colored or else we won't be able to make Saturn rockets.

Edited October 23, 2015 by GregroxMun
If it wouldn't be a trouble, think you could get this to work with Vens Stock Revamp?
Very nice!

Awesome, and quick work!

If it wouldn't be a trouble, think you could get this to work with Vens Stock Revamp?

Completely different model and texture set. It'd be easier for Ven to publish a set than Nothke build another set for another mod.
Works great for me.

Could you provide a alternative texture with the use of Firespitter capability to change between them?
If it wouldn't be a trouble, think you could get this to work with Vens Stock Revamp?

I won't, but the textures are licenced under by-nc-sa 4.0, you can rerelease them if you wish..
Looks really cool!
Can this be updated to 1.0.5 since the Large and Medium Size 3 tanks now share a common .dds file? I tried merging them myself with GIMP, but when I booted up the game the textures were solid white.

Can this be updated to 1.0.5 since the Large and Medium Size 3 tanks now share a common .dds file? I tried merging them myself with GIMP, but when I booted up the game the textures were solid white.

If you don't mind having both, I write the cfg to a set path https://www.dropbox.com/s/lbon9s8i8vrnwrm/nothke-2015_SLS_CDR_textures.zip?dl=0

Just unzip

The install path should be KSP/GameData/nothke-2015_SLS_CDR_textures

Credits:

Original textures by Squad

Repaint by Nothke

Licence: http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-nc-sa/4.0/

EDIT- And you will need ModuleManager *.*.* installed

Edited November 21, 2015 by Mecripp2

Never mind this! I had ModuleManager installed.

Onto my problem:
I place the folder in the download you linked directly above this ^, and when I install and load, I have two of each of the parts. When I launch, it goes to normal, even if I use stock and the mod's one, both are normal on launch and at the VAB Edited November 17, 2015 by legoclone09
MAJOR edits!
Hey, just wanted to say I love this texture. Awesome job!!!

Thanks Nothke!

I really like how they all fit together.

Onto my problem:
I place the folder in the download you linked directly above this ^, and when I install and load, I have two of each of the parts. When I launch, it goes to normal, even if I use stock and the mod's one, both are normal on launch and at the VAB[/QUOTE]

Sorry Fixed it, You can re-download it and give it a try now :wink:
the textures of the fuel tanks don't change.... only SRB and Engine
Nice.
